comments.body:
This change is to address cases like `mysql://amqp:password@localhost` (i.e., "amqp" or "redis" may happen to be part of my user name).

It's not really relating to this PR subject. But it may not be worthwhile to open another PR.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +86,90 @@
result_backend = DEFAULT_CELERY_CONFIG['result_backend']
if 'amqp://' in result_backend or 'redis://' in result_backend or 'rpc://' in result_backend:
    log.warning("You have configured a result_backend of %s, it is highly recommended "
                "to use an alternative result_backend (i.e. a database).", result_backend)

comments.body: Yes, I agree. The same items with different keys...

Reason for this changes:
```
Running a worker with superuser privileges when the
worker accepts messages serialized with pickle is a very bad idea!

If you really want to continue then you have to set the C_FORCE_ROOT
environment variable (but please think about this before you do).

User information: uid=0 euid=0 gid=0 egid=0
```
